# updateFocusIfNeeded()

**Instance Method**

Forces the system to act on a pending focus update for the current environment.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func updateFocusIfNeeded()
```

## Discussion

If the current environment has a pending focus update, calling this method forces the system to update the focus information immediately instead of waiting for the next run loop cycle. If no focus update is pending, this method does nothing.

You create a pending focus update using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSystem/requestFocusUpdate(to:)] method. The system may also schedule focus updates in response to interface-related events.

## Managing focus updates

- **requestFocusUpdate(to:)**: Submits a request to update the focus state of the specified object.
